entries.npc_smuggle_1: Thanks, friend! That bite is starting to itch something awful. This should take care of that. I hope.
entries.npc_reward_1: Good work.  Digger already says that the itching's subsiding.  Take a look at this Gaderiffi staff - it's the Tusken Raiders weapon of choice for close encounters. Maybe you can learn how to better defend against it from examining this one.
entries.next: Still hanging around Wayfar? I wish I had something to keep the place interesting, but it's quiet right now. Thanks again for helping me before.
entries.npc_takeme_2: Thanks, friend! I'm beginning to grow quite fond of you.
entries.player_reset_3: I can't anymore.  You'll need to find someone else.
entries.player_reset_2: I can't anymore.  You'll need to find someone else.
entries.npc_reset_3: Do you know anyone else that would be willing to help? I don't have time for beings that stand by and watch innocents get hurt.
entries.notit_1: What's this going to do for my pain?
entries.npc_breech_2: Help me out!  They're going to get me!
entries.npc_work_3: So, have the farmers been saved?
entries.npc_work_1: Did you give him the vial?
entries.dontknowyou_1: If you can, get to my friend, Tekil.  He can help me.
entries.cantwork: Come back when you're not so preoccupied.
entries.npc_reset_1: Why'd you offer to help then? Excuse me, I'm a busy man.
entries.player_reset_1: I can't anymore.  You'll need to find someone else.
entries.player_3_3: Why are the Sand People attacking the moisture farmers?
entries.player_3_2: What will the Sand People do to Digger?
entries.player_2_3: No, I really don't care about them.
entries.npc_reward_3: Job well done, friend. You're welcome in Wayfar anytime. I came across this robe in my travels but I'm not using it so go ahead, take it as a token of my appreciation.
entries.npc_reward_2: You've done well, friend. Please accept this payment for your valuable services.
entries.npc_4_3: Must be in retaliation for you rescuing Digger and killing off a couple of their warriors.
entries.npc_4_2: I'll spare you the gruesome details of what Sand People do to captives. Those creatures delight in torture. It's a sort of initiation ritual for their young warriors.
entries.npc_4_1: Some kind of plague. Makes your skin turn gray and rot off. Nice, huh?
entries.npc_3_3: Do you know anyone else that would be willing to help? I don't have time for beings that stand by and watch innocents get hurt.
entries.npc_3_1: Why'd you offer to help then? Excuse me, I'm a busy man.
entries.npc_2_3: I'd advise you take some friends along again, friend. Those Tuskens can be tough when faced in larger numbers.
entries.npc_2_2: You gotta hurry. I don't know how many Tusken took Digger so I'd bring some friends along if I were you. These beasts are mindless killers so start blasting the minute you see them.
entries.npc_2_1: Great, thanks. Make sure he takes this vaccine as soon as possible. Gray Rot is only treatable within the first few days of infection.
entries.npc_1_3: It's a good thing I was getting this place ready for a raid. Turns out the Tuskens have sent raiding parties against many of the local moisture farmers. Think you can lend a hand in protecting these citizens?
entries.npc_1_2: Remember Digger? I just received word that the Sand People captured him. We need to get him out of their clutches immediately. I can't go myself because I need to get the settlement ready for a possible Tusken raid. Can you help Digger?
entries.npc_1_1: Are you offering to help? Well sure, I can use you. A friend of mine's been performing some research on Tusken Raider migrations for me. A womp rat bit him last night, and word from Bestine is that those vermin might be carrying a new strain of Gray Rot. Could you take this vaccine out to him and make sure he's doing all right?
